quotes.quote: All other friends may come and go, / All other friendships fail; / But these, the friends I've worked to win, / Oh, they will never stale; / And comfort me till Time shall write / The finish to my tale.
WE have been friends together, /  In sunshine and in shade; / Since first beneath the chestnut-trees / In infancy we played.
You are a true friend pointing me to Him / Lifting my downcast eyes / Turning my wondering gaze to the sky / Proving your love again, you are a true friend
One true friend / Is what you've always been to me / One true friend / Is what I always wanna be
And when I left, it's you who stayed. / You always knew that I'd come home again. / In the end, / You are my one true friend.
Don't have to go out / Lookin' for trouble / Trouble will find you it's a matter of time / That's when you're gonna need someone behind you / A true friend isn't easy to find
From the beginning you've been / Always there my old friend / True until the end of time
You just bear this in mind, a true friend is hard to find / So don't you mind people grinning in your face
Friends come and friends may go / My friend, you're real I know / True self you have shown / You're alright with me / Through thick and thick to thin.
A true friend is hard to find / Go get yourself outside of your mind / Whether it's right or whether it's wrong / I'm on the treadmill all day long
Everybody needs a true, true friend / To help them through the day
It's been so long / Since he had a true friend / True friends are sure hard to come by
You were there through it all, now it's my turn / There's no doubt, good lookin' out / When life's not fair / True friends will always be there
True friends are few and far between / But nothing comes between true friends.
Anytime your world is lonely / And you'll find true friends are few / Anytime you see a rainbow / That will be a sign the storm is through.
In a world of delusion / Never turn your back on a friend / 'cause you can count your / Real true friends on one hand.
I need a true friend to hold on the final round of tears and lonely nights / A sweet companion from now on to hear this very special prayer right.
Let me / Let me sit with you beside a street / Let me / Let me laugh with you and share your dream / I'll be your true friend until the end, you can depend on me / So let me, let me, say you let me.

Sometimes I feel so down / And no one here's around / But you, you never left me lonely / And now I see, what a true friend means / And I trust that you would always be here for me / Lord I give you all.
Don't you mind people grinning in your face / Don't you mind people grinning in your face / There's one thing to bear in mind / A true friend is hard to find.

Well, when you're down and all alone, / There's always somewhere you can go / Here I am / A true friend / There's nothing gonna change over here on my end / Don't be scared / It's better shared / You know I always cared / I'm a everything's all righter / I'm a prizefighter.
To reach out your hand and reconcile, reconcile / And in the end you'll make amends / Be a true friend, strong enough to bend / Be grateful when you start again, start again / When you start again.
True friends stab you in the front / Keep you from getting what you want / When one more fix could kill you / They help you realize that.
A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked.
True friends are those who came into your life, saw the most negative part of you, but are not ready to leave you, no matter how contagious you are to them.
True friends can communicate with their eyes.
